Definition: Add to the current value of n

f"{__}" to add variables to a print statement
% is the modulo operator to find the remainder after division

Input:
nums = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6] 
odd_list = [n for n in nums if n % 2 == 1]
print(odd_list)
Definition: Comprehension list with an if statement
Adding lists merges the lists together to 1 list

The element in nums with index -2 (2nd from last)
Slice a list from [index1:index2], excluding the end index
range(start, end, step) creates a sequence (not a list) of numbers

Sort a list alphabetically or from smallest to greatest
slice(start, stop, step), excluding stop index
length of the string or iterable

Input:
cities = ['Mumbai','New York','Paris','London']
largest = max(cities, key=len)
print(largest)
Definition: returns the largest string based on string length
